*div1 type="summary"* *p*C. B. Penrose to Austin, July 1, 1827. Application to Government for privileges in connection with establishment of a distillery.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe De Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="07-01-1827">July 1st 1827*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear sir*/p*
*p*With this you will receive my petition, to the *person_mentioned*General Government*/person_mentioned*, and if you should deem any alterations necessary, I beg that you will make them.—if you think it essential to redraft the petition, I wish you to consider yourself fully authorised to sign for *person_mentioned*Jos: B Wilkinson and myself*/person_mentioned**/p*.
*p*I have, as you will perceive by reference to the petition asked for— *location_mentioned*Five leagues of Land*/location_mentioned*—with permission to locate in a body or sepe- rately—My reasons for asking this privilege I hope you will find satisfactory; The lands on the *location_mentioned*Brassos */location_mentioned*are, I believe very generally occupied by prior claims,—so that if I were forced to locate the concession in an entire body it would be too remote from the *location_mentioned*Distillery*/location_mentioned*— to derive any advantages from it. The *location_mentioned*Distillery and Sugar House */location_mentioned*(if we establish one) will consume a large quantity of wood annually and if we are forced to bring it from any distance, it would subject us to great inconvenience, and still greater expence. I think the advantages which will result to the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*from the proposed Establishment, fully authorise me in believing that my petition is perfectly reasonable, if you think otherwise however, drop this subject, and urge nothing but the first clause—viz—the privilege of importing me] asses Free of Duty.*/p*
*p*In addition to the information, I have already requested, I would enquire, whether, there are not, now in your *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, several *person_mentioned*carpenters */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Masons */person_mentioned*and if so, could they be employed by the month, and at what price ? Could I not, get at *location_mentioned*San Antonio*/location_mentioned* or elsewhere in the *location_mentioned*Interior*/location_mentioned*, a number of *person_mentioned*Spaniards */person_mentioned*as *person_mentioned*day laborers*/person_mentioned* at low wages? if I can, can I rely upon them, and what price would I have to pay? I am particularly anxious to obtain some knowledge of the *location_mentioned*Mexican markets*/location_mentioned*—The names—situations population, and resources of the various *location_mentioned*Seaport Towns*/location_mentioned*, and those in the *location_mentioned*Interior*/location_mentioned*, accessible to trade, the means of transportation from the nearest *location_mentioned*ports*/location_mentioned*, and the expence attending such transportation*/p*
*p*In the prosecution of my design, I would require correspondents wherever I found a *location_mentioned*market*/location_mentioned*, and if you could furnish me with the names and standing of *person_mentioned*merchants */person_mentioned*in such places as you would designate, from whom I could obtain the desired information, I would address them upon my return to the *location_mentioned*U. S*/location_mentioned*. — In the meantime, I would most thankful [ly] avail myself of your general and extensive knowledge of the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*. With the Mercantile usages of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, the susceptibility of particular places — for a particular branch of trade — and the minutia of business I presume you are unacquainted—but, upon the general resources of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*—- its commercial advantages—its agricultural and monied wealth— the geographical advantages of particular *location_mentioned*ports*/location_mentioned*, as regards their proximity to thickly settled and wealthy *location_mentioned*districts*/location_mentioned*, in short, upon every subject, interesting to a *person_mentioned*stranger*/person_mentioned*, I would apply to you, with a perfect confidence of clear and satisfactory answers—*/p*
*p*I am aware My Dear Sir—that—I am drawing largely upon your promise of information, and trespassing upon your time, but when I remind you of the importance of the business in which I am about to engage and that my entire ruin might be the result of a careless investigation of the capabilities of the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*—you will I am per- suaded pardon my anxiety for obtaining information from the only correct source within my power—I therefore again repeat, that I shall esteem it, a flattering evidence of your friendship, and an important obligation, if you will address me, upon all subjects of general information, which may suggest themselves to you, and which your convenience and leisure may permit you to speak of.*/p*
*p*My anxiety to return to the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* in order to make arrangements for the support of our petition in the Capital induces me, again to mention the subject of my little invoice of Liquors, they stand me in something like $2.50 if you can settle them for that—I wish you would do so of course to be delivered here—at all events make the best arrangement you can for me—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*C. B. Penrose*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Antonio*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
